contentList.content: A Staff of Ice and Fire
An intrinic and exquisite staff that you can tell is immaculately crafted. Unfortunately, the craftsmenship at the end of the staff seems sloppier and unfinished compared to the rest of it.
Ice and Fire
When dealing Cold damage, the wielder deals an additional [1]. When dealing Fire damage, the wielder deals an additional [2].
Ironheart Bow

The commonly held belief that only agility and finesse are key to archery neglects the sheer endurance required. It takes a resilient constitution to maintain perfect form through long, grueling battles.
Ironheart Weapon
This weapon deals additional damage equal to your Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>.
Mindweave Bow
The commonly held belief that archers rely solely on physical prowess is misguided. It takes a keen mind to calculate the perfect trajectory and adjust for wind and distance.
Mindweave Weapon
This weapon deals additional damage equal to your Intelligence <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>.
Owlfeather Bow

The commonly held belief that speed and strength define the ultimate archer overlooks the true essence of mastery. It takes profound insight and patience to see the unseen, knowing when and where to strike.
Owlfeather Weapon
This weapon deals additional damage equal to your Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>.
Silvertongue Bow
The commonly held belief that charisma holds no place in battle is shortsighted. It takes a captivating presence to lead and inspire, turning the tide of conflict with a single shot.
Silvertongue Weapon
This weapon deals additional damage equal to your Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>.
Cataclysm
Carved in circles across the knob of the staff are different words for fire. Gnomish, Sylvan, Elvish, Celestial, even the Primordial tongue - all of these and more fuse together to form the fireword.
Calamity

Carved in circles across the knob of the staff are different words for wrath. Gnomish, Sylvan, Elvish, Celestial, even the Primordial tongue - all of these and more fuse together to form the wrathword.
Coruscate

Carved in circles across the knob of the staff are different words for light. Gnomish, Sylvan, Elvish, Celestial, even the Primordial tongue - all of these and more fuse together to form the lightword.
Cataract

Carved in circles across the knob of the staff are different words for light. Gnomish, Sylvan, Elvish, Celestial, even the Primordial tongue - all of these and more fuse together to form the lightword.
Condemnate

Carved in circles across the knob of the staff are different words for force. Gnomish, Sylvan, Elvish, Celestial, even the Primordial tongue - all of these and more fuse together to form the forceword.
